entries.description: A quickstart pipeline that trains some simple models in parallel.
entries.title: Quickstart Pipeline

entries.description: This is a hello world example of how to run (Py)Spark locally in Orchest, it also contains code for connecting to a remote Spark cluster.
entries.title: Run PySpark in Orchest

entries.description: Scrape webpages with Selenium
entries.title: Using Selenium with Python in Orchest

entries.description: A minimal example of how to fetch Google Search Console data through their Python API.
entries.title: Google Search Console API

entries.description: A minimal example of how to use a fileystem based global key value store, it uses a simple Python dictionary with SQLite as the backing store.
entries.title: Global Key Value store

entries.description: Use dbt inside of Orchest for your materialized views.
entries.title: Orchest + dbt

entries.description: Use Image Super-Resolution (ISR) to enhance any image with different methods.
entries.title: Image Super-Resolution

entries.description: Generate an audio snippet from a text sample and send it as a message on Slack/Discord.
entries.title: Coqui TTS

entries.description: An example of how to use Redis and Postgres in an Orchest pipeline.
entries.title: Redis and Postgres

entries.description: Search scraped comments with semantic vector search.
entries.title: Weaviate + Orchest

entries.description: An example pipeline showing how to use multiple languages in a same Orchest pipeline.
entries.title: Polyglot: Python, Julia and R in one pipeline

entries.description: A pipeline that uses the open source Photon library for webscraping. Use this as a starting point for a data ingest pipeline.
entries.title: Web Scraping using Photon

entries.description: Use web scraping, Meilisearch and PyWebIO for lightning fast comment search on HN.
entries.title: Search HN comments with PyWebIO

entries.description: A pipeline showcasing how Python and R can be used within the same pipeline. It also shows how you can call the Orchest SDK from within R.
entries.title: Mixing R and Python in one pipeline

entries.description: An example pipeline that uses PyCall to be able to call the Orchest SDK from within Julia.
entries.title: Calling the Orchest SDK from Julia

entries.description: Specific example of using the QuickBooks OAuth API in Orchest, but can be used for any OAuth 2.0 authentication flow.
entries.title: OAuth QuickBooks example project

entries.description: This is an example project that demonstrates how to create a pipeline that consists of two phases of execution.
entries.title: Two phase pipeline + Streamlit

entries.description: This pipeline classifies random text paragraphs found on websites linked to from random Wikipedia pages.
entries.title: Scraped language classifier

entries.description: Use popular python library, Deep_AutoViML to build multiple deep learning Keras models on any dataset, any size with this pipeline. Data must be in data folder and models are saved in your project folder.
entries.title: Deep_AutoViML Pipeline

entries.description: Use popular python library, AutoViz to visualize any dataset, any size with this pipeline. Data must be in data folder and charts are saved in AutoViz_Plots fodler.
entries.title: AutoViz Pipeline

entries.description: Spin up a Coiled cluster and run an xgboost train loop on it. Separate Coiled cluster creation step to make it re-usable.
entries.title: Orchest + Coiled: spawn cluster and run XGBoost

entries.description: Experimenting with PyArrow in Orchest
entries.title: Experimenting with PyArrow

entries.description: Out-of-core processing with Vaex in Orchest
entries.title: Out-of-core processing with Vaex

entries.description: Connecting to an external database using SQLAlchemy
entries.title: Connecting to an external database using SQLAlchemy

entries.description: Reading +1M Stack Overflow questions with Polars
entries.title: Reading +1M Stack Overflow questions with Polars

entries.description: Running SQL statements directly in Jupyter using ipython-sql
entries.title: Running SQL statements directly in Jupyter using ipython-sql

entries.description: Creating an ELT pipeline in Orchest that extracts data from PostgreSQL and loads it to BigQuery using meltano and dbt
entries.title: ELT pipeline in Orchest with meltano and dbt

entries.description: Export the raw events generated by Google Analytics 4 to your data warehouse, using Orchest for orchestration, Meltano for Extraction & Loading (EL), and Metabase for visualization
entries.title: Make the most of your Google Analytics data with Orchest and Meltano

entries.description: Create a pipeline that loads time series data from Clarify, trains an anomaly detection model, writes back the anomalies, and notifies you
entries.title: Detect anomalies on your time series data with Orchest and Clarify

entries.description: Create a drift report using Evidently
entries.title: Drift report with Evidently

entries.description: Analyze +4.6M Reddit comments with DuckDB from Parquet files
entries.title: Analyzing +4.6M Reddit comments with DuckDB
